topic.title: How to Control the PDF Viewer

body.p: The PDF document may contain settings for the PDF Viewer. This helps to make the viewing experience common for all of the readers. For example, you can specify the zoom level that the document is presented, or whether the outline view should be displayed.
There are several CSS properties you can use. These properties should be set on the root element. If they are set on multiple elements, the first one will be taken into account.

li.p: The supported include: single-page, two-columns-left, and more.
The supported values include: use-thumbs, use-none. For more details, see the list of Chemistry extension CSS properties.
